p: Eugenol is a clear to pale yellow liquid with an oily consistency and a spicy aroma. It is sparingly soluble in water and well soluble in organic solvents. Eugenol can be produced synthetically in two ways, one of which involves the allylation of guaiacol with allyl chloride. The biotechnological method is based on the biotransformation of a wide range of microorganisms, such as Corynebacterium spp., Streptomyces spp., and Escherichia coli [ 2, 6, 7, 8].
